body: Welcome to Talos community! Thanks so much for creating your first issue :)
Please, is it possible to have a reply?
Does your model work if you run it regularly without Talos? So if you run everything as per above, outside of Talos, do you still get the same error?
Thanks for your reply. Yes, it works regularly outside of Talos. When I use Talos, I can't retrain the best model I get from scan_results.

Actually, you can achieve exactly the same as you are doing above by `scan_results.best_model()`. 

I tested with a very simple model, and I get the same error as you do.
I'm not sure about the implications, but recompiling before retraining seems to work.

> Actually, you can achieve exactly the same as you are doing above by `scan_results.best_model()`.

It's not working, I get the following error when I use `scan_results.best_model()`:

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/keras/utils/generic_utils.py in deserialize_keras_object(identifier, module_objects, custom_objects, printable_module_name)
    138             if cls is None:
    139                 raise ValueError('Unknown ' + printable_module_name +
--> 140                                  ': ' + class_name)
    141         if hasattr(cls, 'from_config'):
    142             custom_objects = custom_objects or {}

ValueError: Unknown initializer: GlorotUniform

> I'm not sure about the implications, but recompiling before retraining seems to work.

I don't want to recompile the best model before retraining it because I would lose the best parameters I just searched for with Talos.

> I don't want to recompile the best model before retraining it because I would lose the best parameters I just searched for with Talos.

Why not recompile with exactly the same hyperparameters?

> > I don't want to recompile the best model before retraining it because I would lose the best parameters I just searched for with Talos.
> 
> Why not recompile with exactly the same hyperparameters?

How can I do so with Talos? Thanks for your time and consideration

> > I don't want to recompile the best model before retraining it because I would lose the best parameters I just searched for with Talos.
> 
> Why not recompile with exactly the same hyperparameters?

How can I print the values of the best parameters (learn_rate, momentum, etc.) I just searched for with Talos?

You can get all the parameters either from the experiment log which is stored according to the `experiment_name` in `Scan()`. Or alternatively through `scan_object.data`. 

To my understanding, you would then just want to use those to recompile the model.

> You can get all the parameters either from the experiment log which is stored according to the `experiment_name` in `Scan()`. Or alternatively through `scan_object.data`.
> 
> To my understanding, you would then just want to use those to recompile the model.

Yes, that's what I want to do. Thank you for your reply.

I'm facing another error now when I try to save the best model with Pickle: 

```
model_id = scan_results.data['val_acc'].astype('float').argmax() - 1
model = model_from_json(scan_results.saved_models[model_id])
model.set_weights(scan_results.saved_weights[model_id])

with open("best_model.pkl", 'wb') as output:
    pickle.dump(model, output, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL)
```

TypeError: can't pickle _thread.RLock objects

Can you share the entire trace. Generally you always want to do that, as it explains exactly what is going wrong. Just seeing the error message itself is mostly not useful. 

Also it seems that this issue is now resolved, so you should open a new ticket for any new issues.
Have a look at #156 as it provides a reference to what you are experiencing.

> Can you share the entire trace. Generally you always want to do that, as it explains exactly what is going wrong. Just seeing the error message itself is mostly not useful.
> 
> Also it seems that this issue is now resolved, so you should open a new ticket for any new issues.

Thanks, I will open another issue.

rename.from: RuntimeError: You must compile your model before training/testing
rename.to: RuntimeError: You must compile your model before training/testing when retraining model
